member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.UIStudio.Dock.DockManager.MagnetismGapDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between windows that are snapped together via magnetism.
member.value: The distance between windows that are snapped together via magnetism. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: If this value is greater than 0, there will be a gap between windows that are snapped together when magnetism is enabled by the property.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.UIStudio.Dock.DockManager.MagnetismSnapDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance at which magnetism begins to snap windows being dragged.
member.value: The distance at which magnetism begins to snap windows being dragged. The default value is 5.
member.remarks: If this value is greater than 0, magnetism is enabled. Set it to 0 to disable magnetism. Magnetism tries to snap corners of a window being dragged to other window corners around it. Increase this property's value to increase the range over which the magnetism will work. Magnetism also takes effect when resizing via window borders.

member.summary: Provides the place to perform measurement logic for the element.
member.param: The object to use for measurement.

The available size that parent can give to the child. The child can return bigger in hopes that the parent will become scrollable. The value may also be infinity to indicate that the desired measurements of the element are wanted.
member.returns: is designed to be the main customizability point for size control of layout. Element authors should override this method, call on each child element, and compute their desired size based upon the measurement of the children. The return value should be the desired size. It is required that a parent element calls on each child or they won't be sized/arranged.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.UIStudio.Dock.TabbedMdiWindow.Active
member.summary: Gets whether the window is active.
member.value: true if the window is active; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: An active window is one which is active in the application but not necessarily visible.

If a window is attached to another window in tabbed MDI and they have a control determining which one is displayed, both are considered active since they are currently available to be used but only the displayed window is flagged as visible.

member.summary: Provides the place to perform measurement logic for the element.
member.param: The object to use for measurement.

The available size that parent can give to the child. The child can return bigger in hopes that the parent will become scrollable. The value may also be infinity to indicate that the desired measurements of the element are wanted.
member.returns: is designed to be the main customizability point for size control of layout. Element authors should override this method, call on each child element, and compute their desired size based upon the measurement of the children. The return value should be the desired size. It is required that a parent element calls on each child or they won't be sized/arranged.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.UIStudio.TabStrip.TabStripButton.MeasureCore(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Provides the place to perform measurement logic for the element.
member.param: The object to use for measurement.

The available size that parent can give to the child. The child can return bigger in hopes that the parent will become scrollable. The value may also be infinity to indicate that the desired measurements of the element are wanted.
member.returns: is designed to be the main customizability point for size control of layout. Element authors should override this method, call on each child element, and compute their desired size based upon the measurement of the children. The return value should be the desired size. It is required that a parent element calls on each child or they won't be sized/arranged.

member.summary: Provides the place to perform measurement logic for the element.
member.param: The object to use for measurement.

The available size that parent can give to the child. The child can return bigger in hopes that the parent will become scrollable. The value may also be infinity to indicate that the desired measurements of the element are wanted.
member.returns: is designed to be the main customizability point for size control of layout. Element authors should override this method, call on each child element, and compute their desired size based upon the measurement of the children. The return value should be the desired size. It is required that a parent element calls on each child or they won't be sized/arranged.
